content.description: Climb through a low bulge and through a short face.
content.location: Just left of Anthem and slightly down hill on a separate boulder. Sit start on a good rail, work up and right through the bulge and climb straight up the face. A variation continues angling right before topping out at the same grade.

content.description: Lightly overhanging crimp line with a few powerful moves mixed in.
content.location: Walk south past Nana Nana and Anthem to the next boulder. Kung Fu Grip sit-starts on the south face of the boulder on good edges. Continue through a series of crimps to gain a big ledge at 3/4 height before reaching to the lip of the boulder.

content.description: A striking aréte on the west side of the boulder that’s most northeast in the cluster.
content.location: Stand start and climb the striking aréte.

content.description:
NO IDEA if this has been established or not, but it was chalkless and this area seems to not get a ton of traffic, but I am not a Red Rocks expert so somebody else might know better than me. Either way, I thought this climb was excellent and adds to this little zone's circuit of moderates. -Jake

 Start standing with both hands on an undercling, a low left foot, and a high right heel hook. Move up and left through an immaculate crimp and top out to the left on slopers/jugs.
content.location: This problem is found opposite Anthem, 10 feet to the right of Nana Nana. Start standing on an undercling arete at the south side of the boulder and climb up and left through the perfect crimp in the overhang.

content.description: Start standing, move straight up through the overhang to an exhilarating mantle.
content.location: 8 feet to the left of Anthem at the Monument Boulders

content.description: A picturesque square-cut overhanging aréte lies in the heart of the main cluster of the Monument Boulders.
content.location: Large boulder right beside Nana Nana. Sit-start low on underclings then power and finesse your way along the overhanging aréte and pull over the lip at the end to top out.

content.description: The first cluster of boulders you come across when going to Mustang Canyon.
